title: 7000 Oaks
name: 7000 Oaks
description:
A Map by Cecilkleakins

A Map of the known locations of any of the 7000 Oak trees planted as part of German artist Joseph Beuys' sculpture project entitled 7000 Oaks, begun in 1982 in Kassel, Germany.  

&quot;7000 Oaks is a sculpture referring to peoples' life, to their everyday work. That is my concept of art which I call the extended concept or art of the social sculpture.&quot; – Joseph Beuys

More Info:
http://www.diacenter.org/ltproj/7000

properties.name: 1 Tree at the Walker Art Center Sculpture Garden (planted 1997)
properties.description: Posted by Cecilkleakins  Walker Art Center Sculpture GardenA single symbolic tree with basalt stele was planted in the Minneapolis Sculpture Garden at the Walker Arts Center.

properties.name: 1,031 Trees in Cass Lake, Minnesota (planted in 1997)
properties.description: Posted by Cecilkleakins Cass Lake, MinnesotaIn Cass Lake, a reservation town in Northern Minnesota, 1,031 seedlings were planted representing approximately one tree per resident. The planting itself took place over a one-week period in late May 1997. Residents themselves determined where the trees were sited -- on their own property as well as on public land -- and were actively involved in the planting as well. In conjunction with the 1997 show "Joseph Beuys Multiples" at the Walker Art Center in Minneapolis. Project was coordinated by independent curator Todd Bockley with support from the Visual Arts Department, as well as the Education Department\'s Teen Programs and Community Programs. More Info: http://www.walkerart.org/archive/9/A343D1DFBAD672436161.htm

properties.name: 18 Trees on W. 22nd St. between 10th & 11th Ave (planted 1996)
properties.description: Posted by Cecilkleakins 18 Trees on West 22nd St Between 10th & 11th Ave (planted 1996)In 1996 Dia extended this project by planting 18 new trees, each paired with a basalt stone, on 22nd Street from 10th to 11th avenues, adding Pin Oak, Red Oak, Elm Honey Locust, Gingko and Linden.

properties.name: 5 Trees at the DIA Foundation (planted 1988)
properties.description: Posted by Cecilkleakins 5Dia installed five basalt stone columns, each paired with a tree, at 548 West 22nd Street in 1988, continuing the sculpture project 7000 Eichen (7000 Oaks) by German artist Joseph Beuys. Five different varieties of trees were planted: gingko, linden, bradford pear, sycamore, and oak.

properties.name: 7000 Eichen, Joseph Beuys
properties.description: Posted by Kaicarver"Joseph Beuys never lived in Kassel, but his name is inseparably tied to the city. No other work of art is so thoroughly and lastingly integrated into the topographic and social structure of the city. The planting of a tree alongside a basalt stone in 7,000 points of Kassel began in 1982, as a contribution to Documenta 7, and was finished in 1987, for Documenta 8 [after Beuys\'s death]." (actually I\'m not sure where this photo was taken) Beuys lives on in recent "documenta": http://www.pop.ac/kassel_documenta_10_1997_the_chewing_gum_of_joseph_beuys.html

properties.name: Beuys's 7000 Oaks at Oslo National Academy of the Arts (KHiO)
properties.description: Posted by Kaicarver Oslo, NorwayI\'m not sure exactly where this is in Oslo, especially since the school has several buildings, and my Norwegian\'s feeling a little rough this morning.

properties.name: Beuys-Bäumen
properties.description: Posted by Kaicarver"emergency come I as a tree!"

properties.name: Joseph Beuys, 7000 Eichen - Stadtverwaldung statt Stadtverwaltung, Kassel, Wegmannstraße
properties.description: Posted by KaicarverKassel, GermanyBeuys\'s project, "7000 Oaks - City planting instead of city planning", was begun in 1982 at Documenta 7, the large international art exhibition in Kassel, Germany. His plan called for the planting of seven thousand trees, each paired with a columnar basalt stone approximately four feet high above ground, throughout the greater city of Kassel.

properties.name: Middlebury College, 7000 Oaks, 1982-87/1998
properties.description: Posted by KaicarverMiddlebury, VT 057537000 Eichen (7000 Oaks), 1982-87/1998 Basalt marker and red oak tree Tree and basalt stone planted by the Middlebury College Museum of Art in memory of the artist Joseph Beuys 1998.00 "in contemplating this site the viewer is connected with a network of other viewers contemplating similar installations in numerous places on the planet."

properties.name: Stadtverwaldung: Ein Teil von Joseph Beuys 7000 Eichen an der Hasenhecke
properties.description: Posted by KaicarverSome of Beuys\'s "7000 oaks" are planted in Wolfsanger-Hasenhecke, a 1200-year-old town that became part of Kassel in 1936. On October 3, 1943, "Erntedanktag" ("Harvest-Thanksgiving-Day"), Allied bombs entirely destroyed the town. http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolfsanger
